bitfield.description: Controls the storage of image sensor RAW data in memory. This bit is loaded with the timing of the internal VD signal: it becomes active starting at the lead of the VD signal that comes after 1 is written in this bit.
Controls ON/OFF of VD/HD output. Internal timing generator becomes active and VD/HD output starts when 1 is written in this bit. In case of input, VD/HD loading begins.
Read returns reset value
Low pass filter enable. When this bit is enabled, a 3-tap (1/4 + 1/2 Z + 1/4 Z) filtering process is performed on the sensor data.
Data input mode:
ISIF module write port overflow status bit If the write port of the ISIF module overflows when writing data to SDRAM, this bit will toggle.

This bit enables to shift right (divide) the up-to-12-bit RAW data value when writing out to SDRAM. The effect is that the dynamic of the output signal is decreased. The ISIF_MODESET.CCDW, ISIF_HSIZE.ADCR, ISIF_HSIZE.HSIZE, ISIF_CCDCFG.BSWD, ISIF_CCDCFG.MSBINV, ISIF_CCDCFG.SDRPACK bit fields control how pixel data are stored to SDRAM.
Field mode: This bit selects the type of image sensor: interlaced or progressive
Image sensor input data polarity
External WEN selection In case this bit and SYNCEN.DWEN are set to 1, the external WEN signal is used to store image sensor data to memory.
Read returns reset value
HD Sync Signal Polarity
VD Sync Signal Polarity
FLD Signal Direction. There must be at least three clock cycles between the time this bit is modified and the HD/VD pulse for the start of frame comes.
VD,HD Sync Signal Direction. There must be at least three clock cycles between the time this bit is modified and the HD/VD pulse for the start of frame comes.
HD width: Sets width of HD. HD width = HDW + 1 clock
VD width : Sets width of VD. VD width = VDW + 1 line

Pixels per line Number of pixel clock periods in one line HD period = PPLN+1 pixel clocks. PPLN is not used when HD and VD are inputs, that is, when VDHDOUT in MODESET is cleared to 0. *This bit field is latched by VD.

Half lines per filed or frame Sets number of half lines per frame or field. VD period = (LPFR+1)/2 lines. LPFR is not used when HD and are inputs, that is, when VDHDOUT in MODESET is cleared to 0. *This bit field is latched by VD.
The first pixel in a line to be stored to memory.
Number of pixels in an line to be stored to memory. Number of pixels = LNH + 1.
The number of lines to be stored to SDRAM.
The number of lines to be stored to memory. Number of lines = LNV + 1
Culling Pattern in ODD Line: Sets culling pattern when data is loaded into memory (odd lines). Example: 0xAA: 1 / 2 horizontal direction culling. LSB becomes left side on screen.
Culling Pattern in Even Line: Sets culling pattern when data is loaded into memory (even lines).
Culling Pattern in Vertical Line Example: 0x88: 1/4 vertical direction culling. LSB becomes top side on screen.

SDRAM address decrement. By setting this bit, memory address in a line is automatically decreased so that a line can be Horizontally flipped in memory. The ISIF_MODESET.CCDW, ISIF_HSIZE.ADCR, ISIF_HSIZE.HSIZE, ISIF_CCDCFG.BSWD, ISIF_CCDCFG.MSBINV, ISIF_CCDCFG.SDRPACK bit fields control how pixel data are stored to SDRAM.
Memory address offset between the lines. Specify the offset in 32-byte units.
Memory Address (Upper 11-bits): Specifies the memory destination address. The actual address is the value set here multiplied by 32bytes.
Memory Address (Lower 16-bits): Specifies the memory destination address. The actual address is the value set here multiplied by 32bytes.
Shift up value for the correction value (S10).
Linearization Mode:
Linearization Enable:

Scale factor (U11Q10) for LUT input. Range: 0 - 1+1023/1024 It is applied to the Input Data before looking up the correction factor. The scale factor is only applied to the table input. It is not applied when using the input value to compute the output.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 0 (Field 1) Pixel position 0 corresponds to pixel count=0 at even line in case of CFAP= 0, and to pixel count=0 in case of CFAP= 1.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 1 (Field 1) Pixel position 1 corresponds to pixel count=1 at even line in case of CFAP= 0, and to pixel count=1 in case of CFAP= 1.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 2 (Field 1) Pixel position 2 corresponds to pixel count=0 at odd line in case of CFAP= 0, and to pixel count=2 in case of CFAP= 1.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 3 (Field 1) Pixel position 3 corresponds to pixel count=1 at odd line in case of CFAP= 0. Not applicable for CFAP= 1.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 0 (Field 0) Pixel position 0 corresponds to pixel count=0 at even line in case of CFAP= 0, and to pixel count=0 in case of CFAP= 1.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 1 (Field 0) Pixel position 1 corresponds to pixel count=1 at even line in case of CFAP= 0, and to pixel count=1 in case of CFAP= 1.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 2 (Field 0) Pixel position 2 corresponds to pixel count=0 at odd line in case of CFAP= 0, and to pixel count=2 in case of CFAP= 1.
Specifies color pattern for pixel position 3 (Field 0) Pixel position 3 corresponds to pixel count=1 at odd line in case of CFAP= 0. Not applicable for CFAP= 1.
R/Ye gain: Performs gain adjustment on image sensor data. U12Q9. Range: 0 - 7+511/512
Gr/Cy gain: Performs gain adjustment on image sensor data. U12Q9. Range: 0 - 7+511/512
Gb/Cy gain: Performs gain adjustment on image sensor data. U12Q9. Range: 0 - 7+511/512
B/Mg gain: Performs gain adjustment on image sensor data. U12Q9. Range: 0 - 7+511/512
Image sensor offset: Performs offset value adjustment on image sensor data (0~4095).
VD0 Interrupt timing in a field (line number).
VD1 Interrupt timing in a field (line number).
VD2 Interrupt timing in a field (line number).
Selects Predictor for DPCM Encoder (12-8)
Enables DPCM Encoding (12-8)
White Balance Enable for H3A
White Balance Enable for IPIPE
White Balance Enable for memory capture
Offset control Enable for H3A
Offset control Enable for IPIPE
Offset control Enable for SDRAM capture
Selects CFA pattern

bitenum.description: Mosaic color pattern. It should look like this. G R G R G R G R G R . . . B G B G B G B G B G . . . G R G R G R G R G R . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
Stripe color pattern. It should look like this. R G B R G B R G B . . . R G B R G B R G B . . . R G B R G B R G B . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

bitfield.description: Selects MSB position of Input Data
On/Off control of A-law table for SDRAM capture
CCIR Rec.656 interface mode
Error correction of FVH code

On/off control of CPU registers resynchronize function by VSYNC. All the others are shadowed registers, where register values are updated at V-sync timing by default. If VDLC=1, ISIF register values are updated immediately after register write just like non-shadowed registers.
Reserved. must always be set to 0.

MSB inverse of CIN port when the data are captured to SDRAM. The ISIF_MODESET.CCDW, ISIF_HSIZE.ADCR, ISIF_HSIZE.HSIZE, ISIF_CCDCFG.BSWD, ISIF_CCDCFG.MSBINV, ISIF_CCDCFG.SDRPACK bit fields control how pixel data are stored to SDRAM.

On/off control of Byte SWAP function when SDRAM capturing. The ISIF_MODESET.CCDW, ISIF_HSIZE.ADCR, ISIF_HSIZE.HSIZE, ISIF_CCDCFG.BSWD, ISIF_CCDCFG.MSBINV, ISIF_CCDCFG.SDRPACK bit fields control how pixel data are stored to SDRAM.
Selects Y signal position when in 8bit input mode
Setting 1 to this register, the SDRAM address is initialized at the rising edge of FID input signal or DWEN register.
Select trigger source signal of SDRAM address initializing in case EXTRG=1.
Specifies the CCD valid area.

bitenum.description: internal valid signal and WEN signal is ANDed logically.
internal valid signal and WEN signal is ORed logically.

bitfield.description: Specifies FID detection mode

bitenum.description: latch the FID at the VSYNC timing

bitfield.description: Selects bit width of CCIR656. This bit applies only ifISIF_REC656IF.R656ON = 1.

The ISIF module has a 16-bit interface. When 16-bit YUV data are input, the luma data (YIN7-0) are expected to be on the 8 MS bits and the chroma (CIN7-0) data are expected to be on the LS bits. This bit enables to swap the 8 MS bits with the 8 LS bits of the interface in case the luma and chroma do not come in the correct order. See the top-level ISIF block diagram.

bitenum.description: YIN7-0 = Y signal / CIN7-0 = C signal
YIN7-0 = C signal / CIN7-0 = Y signal

bitfield.description: Reserved. must always be set to 0.
Reserved. must always be set to 0.

This bit field selects how the data are stored to SDRAM. There can be 8, 12 or 16 bits per pixel. The ISIF_MODESET.CCDW, ISIF_HSIZE.ADCR, ISIF_HSIZE.HSIZE, ISIF_CCDCFG.BSWD, ISIF_CCDCFG.MSBINV, ISIF_CCDCFG.SDRPACK bit fields control how pixel data are stored to SDRAM.

Vertical line Defect level shift value Defect Level (value to be subtracted from the data) is 8bit width, but can be up-shifted up to 6bits by VDFLSFT. Left shift value = VDFLSFT (Range: 0-6) Setting 7 to VDFLSFT is not allowed.
Vertical line Defect Correction upper pixels disable.

bitenum.description: Pixels upper than the defect are not corrected.

bitfield.description: Vertical line Defect Correction mode select.

bitenum.description: Defect level subtraction. Just fed through if data are saturating.
Defect level subtraction. Horizontal interpolation ((i-2)+(i+2))/2 if data are saturating.

bitfield.description: Vertical line Defect Correction enable. This bit field is latched by VD.
Vertical line Defect Correction saturation level. VDFSLV is U12 (Range: 0 - 4,095).
Defect correction. Memory clear. Writing 1 to this bit clears the memory contents to all zero. It will be automatically cleared to `0` when the memory clear is completed.

Defect correction. Memory address reset. Setting DFCMWR or DFCMRD with LSCMARST set starts memory access to address offset 0. DFCMARST is automatically cleared if data transfer completes. Setting DFCMWR or DFCMRD with LSCMARST cleared starts memory access to the next address.

bitenum.description: Clear the memory address to offset 0

bitfield.description: Defect correction. Memory read [for debug purpose] Writing 1 to this bit starts reading from the memory. It will be automatically cleared when the data transfer is completed, and the data can be read from DFCMEM4-0.

Defect correction. Memory write Writing 1 to this bit starts writing to the memory. It will be automatically cleared when the data transfer is completed. DFCMEM4-0 should be set prior to the memory access.
Defect correction memory 0 Sets V position of the defects.
Defect correction memory 1 Sets H position of the defects.

Defect correction Memory 2 Set SUB1: Defect level of the Vertical line defect position (V = Vdefect). DFCMEM2 can be up shifted according to VDFLSFT, and subtracted from the data for Vertical line defect correction.

&lt;Defect correction&gt; Memory 3 Set SUB2: Defect level of the pixels upper than the Vertical line defect (V &lt; Vdefect). DFCMEM3 can be up shifted according to VDFLSFT, and subtracted from the data for Vertical line defect correction.

Memory 4 Set SUB3: Defect level of the pixels lower than the Vertical line defect (V &gt; Vdefect). DFCMEM4 can be up shifted according to VDFLSFT, and subtracted from the data for Vertical line defect correction.
Black clamp mode Clamp value can be calculated regardless of the color or can be calculated separately for each 4 colors.

bitenum.description: Clamp value calculated regardless of the pixel color.
Clamp value calculated separately for each 4 colors.

bitfield.description: Horizontal Clamp mode

bitenum.description: Horizontal clamp disabled. Only the Vertical clamp value is subtracted from the Image data.
Horizontal clamp value calculation enabled. The calculated Horizontal clamp value is subtracted from the Image data along with the Vertical clamp value.
Horizontal clamp value not updated. The Horizontal clamp value used for the previous image is subtracted from the Image data along with the Vertical clamp value.

bitfield.description: Black Clamp Enable Enables clamp value to be subtracted from Image data.
DC offset for black clamp This value is added to the incoming pixels regardless whether optical black clamp is enabled (ISIF_CLAMPCFG.CLEN). This value is in S13Q0 format.
Black Clamp Start position (V). Sets the line number where clamp value subtraction starts. Range: 0 - 8191
Horizontal Black clamp - Vertical dimension of a Window (2).
Horizontal Black clamp - Horizontal dimension of a Window (2).

Horizontal Black clamp - Pixel value limitation for the Horizontal clamp value calculation. If this bit is set, the maximum pixel value to be used for the clamp value calculation would be limited to 1023. By setting this bit, the pixel value greater than 1023 will be replaced by the last pixel value which was equal to or less than 1023. In case ISIF_CLAMPCFG.CLMD=1 (4-color mode), the pixel value greater than 1023 will be replaced by the last pixel value of the same color which was equal to or less than 1023.
Horizontal Black clamp - Base Window select
Horizontal Black clamp - Window count per color Window count = CLHWC+1 Range: 1 - 32
Horizontal black clamp. Window Start position (H). Range: 0 - 8191
Horizontal black clamp. Window Start position (V). Range: 0 - 8191
Vertical black clamp reset value. (U12) Range: 0 to 4095

Vertical Black clamp - Line average coefficient (k). Set a coefficient which is applied to the line average for clamp value calculation. (1-k) is applied to the clamp value of the previous line. Value in the U8Q8 format, the range is 0 to 255/256.
Vertical Black clamp - reset value selection Select the reset value for the clamp value of the previous line

bitenum.description: The base value calculated for Horizontal direction
Value set via the configuration register
No update (same as the previous image)

bitfield.description: Vertical Black clamp - Optical Black H valid (2).
Vertical black clamp. Window Start position (H). Range: 0 - 8191
Vertical black clamp. Window Start position (V). Range: 0 - 8191
Vertical black clamp. Optical black V valid (V). Range: 0 - 8191
H direction Data offset for Lens Shading Correction. Range: 0-16,383 Not valid if the Formatter is enabled.
V direction Data offset for Lens Shading Correction. Range: 0-16,383
Number of valid pixels in H direction. HVAL is for LSC. Number of valid pixels = HVAL+ 1
Number of valid lines in V direction. VVAL is for LSC. Number of valid lines = VVAL+ 1
Define the horizontal dimension of a paxel. Possible values are listed below.
Define the vertical dimension of a paxel. Possible values are listed below.
Busy bit
Sets gain table format

bitenum.description: Coded as 3-bit integer, 5-bit fraction Range from 0 to 7+31/32
Coded as 8-bit fraction + 1.0 of base Range from 1 to 1+255/256
Coded as 3-bit integer, 5-bit fraction + 1.0 Range from 1 to 8+31/32
Coded as 8-bit fraction Range from 0 to 255/256
Coded as 1-bit integer, 7-bit fraction Range from 0 to 1+127/128
Coded as 2-bit integer, 6-bit fraction Range from 0 to 3+63/64
Coded as 2-bit integer, 6-bit fraction + 1.0 Range from 1 to 4+63/64
Coded as 1-bit integer, 7-bit fraction + 1.0 Range from 1 to 2+127/128

bitfield.description: Enables/disables LSC

bitenum.description: Disables the module at the end of the current frame.

bitfield.description: Scaling factor for Offsets (U8Q7) Range: 0 to 1+127/128
Shift up value for Offsets (S8Q0)
Enables/disables Offset control in LSC
Initial Y Y position, in pixels, of the first active pixel in reference to the first active paxel. Must be an even number.
Initial X X position, in pixels, of the first active pixel in reference to the first active paxel. Must be an even number.
Gain Table address base (Upper 16-bits) Table address in bytes. Table is 32-bit aligned so this register must be a multiple of 4. This bit field sets the address of the gain table in memory.
Gain Table address base (Lower 16-bits) Table address in bytes. Table is 32-bit aligned so this register must be a multiple of 4. This bit field sets the address of the gain table in memory.

Gain Table offset Defines the length, in bytes, of one row of the table. Table is 32-bit aligned, so this value must be a multiple of 4. Note that the row in memory could be longer than what LSC uses.
Offset Table address base (Upper 16-bits) Table address in bytes. Table is 32-bit aligned so this register must be a multiple of 4. This bit field sets the address of the gain table in memory.
Offset Table address base (Lower 16-bits) Table address in bytes. Table is 32-bit aligned so this register must be a multiple of 4. This bit field sets the address of the gain table in memory.

Offset Table offset Defines the length, in bytes, of one row of the table. Table is 32-bit aligned, so this value must be a multiple of 4. Note that the row in memory could be longer than what LSC uses.
Interrupt status for LSC SOF Indicates the start of the LSC valid region. LSC configuration registers can be updated after LSC SOF for the next frame.

Interrupt enable for Prefetch Complete Indicates current state of the prefetch buffer. Could be used to start sending the data once the buffer is full to minimize the risk of an underflow. This event is triggered when the buffer contains 3 full paxel rows.

Interrupt enable for Prefetch Error The prefetch error indicates when the gain table was read to slowly from SDRAM. When this event is pending the module goes into transparent mode (output=input). Normal operation can be resumed at the start of the next frame after 1) clearing this event 2) disabling the LSC module 3) enabling it
Interrupt enable for LSC Done The event is triggered when the internal state of LSC toggles from BUSY to IDLE.
Interrupt status for LSC SOF Indicates the start of the LSC valid region. LSC configuration registers can be updated after LSC SOF for the next frame.

bitenum.description: Event is not pending (r) Bit remains unchanged (w)
Event is pending (r) Event is cleared (w)

bitfield.description: Interrupt status for Prefetch Complete Indicates current state of the prefetch buffer. Could be used to start sending the data once the buffer is full to minimize the risk of an underflow. This event is triggered when the buffer contains 3 full paxel rows. It could be used to minimize buffer underflow risks.

bitenum.description: Event is not pending (r) Bit remains unchanged (w)
Event is pending (r) Event is cleared (w)

bitfield.description: Interrupt status for Prefetch Error The prefetch error indicates when the gain table was read to slowly from SDRAM. When this event is pending the module goes into transparent mode (output=input). Normal operation can be resumed at the start of the next frame after 1) clearing this event 2) disabling the LSC module 3) enabling it

bitenum.description: Event is not pending (r) Bit remains unchanged (w)
Event is pending (r) Event is cleared (w)

bitfield.description: Interrupt status for LSC Done The event is triggered when the internal state of LSC toggles from BUSY to IDLE.

bitenum.description: Event is not pending (r) Bit remains unchanged (w)
Event is pending (r) Event is cleared (w)

bitfield.description: Address increment Address increment = (FMTAINC + 1) Range (1-16) *This bit is latched by VD.
Split/Combine number of lines *This bit is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: 1 input line -> 2 output lines (FMTCBL=0) 2 input lines -> 1 output line (FMTCBL=1)
1 input line -> 4 output lines (FMTCBL=0) 4 input lines -> 1 output line (FMTCBL=1)
1 input line -> 3 output lines (FMTCBL=0) 3 input lines -> 1 output line (FMTCBL=1)

bitfield.description: Line alternating *This bit is latched by VD.
Combine Input lines *This bit is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Split 1 input line into multiple output lines
Combine multiple input lines into 1 output line

bitfield.description: CCD Formatter enable *This bit is latched by VD.
Number of program entries for SET3 Number of entries = (FMTPLEN3 + 1) Range: 1-8 Valid only if FMTCBL is set *This bit is latched by VD.
Number of program entries for SET2 Number of entries = (FMTPLEN2 + 1) Range: 1-8 Valid only if FMTCBL is set *This bit is latched by VD.

Number of program entries for SET1 Number of entries = (FMTPLEN1 + 1) Range: 1-16 (FMTCBL = 0) 1-8 (FMTCBL = 1) Setting a value greater than 7 to FMTPLEN1 is not allowed if FMTCBL is set *This bit is latched by VD.

Number of program entries for SET0 Number of entries = (PLEN0 + 1) Range: 1-16 (FMTCBL = 0) 1-8 (FMTCBL = 1) Setting a value greater than 7 to FMTPLEN1 is not allowed if FMTCBL is set *This bit is latched by VD.
The first pixel in a line fed into the formatter
Number of pixels in a line fed to the formatter. Number of pixels = FMTLNH + 1
Start line vertical
Number of lines in vertical Number of lines = FMTLNV + 1
Number of pixels in an output line Maximum value = 4480
HD interval for output lines Set all 0 to this register if combining multiple lines into a single line
The output line the address belongs to Valid only if FMTCBL is cleared

Controls ON/OFF of Color Space converter.
Color Space convert coefficient value M01: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M00: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M03: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M02: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M11: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M10: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M13: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M12: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M21: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M20: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M23: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M22: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M31: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M30: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M33: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Color Space convert coefficient value M32: This value is signed 8-bit with the 5-bits decimal.
Forces isif_clken1 to be active. (Test mode)
Forces isif_clken2 to be active. (Test mode)
